document.docAuthor: Begum, Salma, Anis, Shoeba Binte & Khan, Mohd Talib
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Indian species of Oligosita Walker (Hymenoptera: Trichogrammatidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Indian species of Oligosita Walker (Hymenoptera: Trichogrammatidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Indian species of
Oligosita
(females)

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Pronotum medially membranous, consisting of two plates (
Fig. 25
). Subgenus
Oligosita s. str.
......................... 2

3 . Clava 3.6 × as long as broad (
Fig. 3
); fore wing about 4.4 × as long as broad (
Fig. 6
); ovipositor about 1.1 × as long as hind tibia..........................................................................
O . aseta Begum & Anis
,
sp. nov.
4 . Fore wing disc beyond venation with one or two lines of setae ( Figs 13 , 15 )....................................... 5
- Fore wing disc beyond venation with more than two lines of setae or setae irregularly distributed ( Figs 2 , 24 )............ 11

8 . Gaster wholly red; fore wing disc with two lines of setae beyond venation (
Fig. 33
); reddish pigment absent from fore wing veins and hind leg....................................................................
O . sanguinea (Girault)

- Gaster with about distal two-thirds white; fore wing beyond venation with a single line of 5–11 setae along anterior margin (
Fig. 27
); fore wing veins and legs with reddish suffusions..................................
O . novisanguinea Girault

9 . Fore wing disc with a single, apically curved line of setae along wing margin, and without a line of setae distal to stigmal vein (
Yousuf & Shafee 1992 : fig. B
)..................................................
O . longipennis Yousuf & Shafee

- Fore wing disc with an apically curved line of setae along wing margin and with a line of setae distal to stigmal vein ( Figs 22 , 35 )................................................................................................ 10

10 . Fore wing with two infuscate patches, one below stigmal vein and the second an oblique fascia below premarginal vein (
Fig. 35
)...........................................................................
O . younusi Yousuf & Shafee

- Fore wing hyaline with an infuscate spot appended to stigmal vein (
Fig. 22
)............
O . longirhinaria Yousuf & Shafee

- Clava 7 × as long as broad; fore wing 4 × as long as broad (
Yousuf & Joshi 2003 : figs A, B
).
O . longiflagellata Yousuf & Joshi

13 . Antennal clava with a drumstick-like apical extension ( Figs 19 , 23 ); fore wing less than 4 × as long as broad, and disc sparsely setose.............................................................................................. 14

- Clava longer than scape (
Fig. 1
)...............................................
O . angustipennis Yousuf & Shafee
